author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Immerse yourself in Japanese culture in London during Japan Matsuri festivalTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Immerse yourself in Japanese culture in London during Japan Matsuri festival Published on : Tuesday, September 15, 2015
Be transported to Japan without leaving London as the annual Japan Matsuri festival on September 19 celebrates 150 years of friendship between London and Japan this year and the story of the Satsuma Students from Kagoshima.
The family-friendly festival offers a lively mix of Manga, karaoke, traditional food, live music and martial arts.
Performances take place all day across the two stages with music, martial arts, songs and dance, and special appearances by a number of acts from Kagoshima including drum dancers Izaku Taiko Odori and the brave samurai character Satsuma Kenshi Hayato.
There is traditional Japanese festival food for food lovers at the many stalls. For children of all ages there are Japanese cartoons with the Manga Wall. This is the perfect mix of culture and fun, with something to enjoy for all the family.
